problem_names: theorem realfun_mon_conv_iff: "(u\<up>f) = (\<forall>w. (\<lambda>n. u n w)\<up>((f w)::real))"

lemma assumes mon_conv: "x\<up>(y::real)"
  shows mon_conv_mon: "(x i) \<le> (x (m+i))"
lemma limseq_shift_iff: "(\<lambda>m. x (m+i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y = x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y"

theorem assumes mon_conv: "x\<up>(y::real)"
  shows real_mon_conv_le: "x i \<le> y"

theorem assumes mon_conv: "x\<up>(y::('a \<Rightarrow> real))"
  shows realfun_mon_conv_le: "x i \<le> y"

lemma assumes mon_conv: "x\<up>(y::real)"
  and less: "z < y"
  shows real_mon_conv_outgrow: "\<exists>n. \<forall>m. n \<le> m \<longrightarrow> z < x m"

theorem real_mon_conv_times: 
  assumes xy: "x\<up>(y::real)" and nn: "0\<le>z"
  shows "(\<lambda>m. z*x m)\<up>(z*y)"

theorem realfun_mon_conv_times: 
  assumes xy: "x\<up>(y::'a\<Rightarrow>real)" and nn: "0\<le>z"
  shows "(\<lambda>m w. z*x m w)\<up>(\<lambda>w. z*y w)"

theorem real_mon_conv_add: 
  assumes xy: "x\<up>(y::real)" and ab: "a\<up>(b::real)"
  shows "(\<lambda>m. x m + a m)\<up>(y + b)"

theorem realfun_mon_conv_add:
  assumes xy: "x\<up>(y::'a\<Rightarrow>real)" and ab: "a\<up>(b::'a \<Rightarrow> real)"
  shows "(\<lambda>m w. x m w + a m w)\<up>(\<lambda>w. y w + b w)"

theorem real_mon_conv_bound:
  assumes mon: "\<And>n. c n \<le> c (Suc n)"
  and bound: "\<And>n. c n \<le> (x::real)"
  shows "\<exists>l. c\<up>l \<and> l\<le>x"

theorem real_mon_conv_dom:
  assumes xy: "x\<up>(y::real)" and mon: "\<And>n. c n \<le> c (Suc n)"
  and dom: "c \<le> x"
  shows "\<exists>l. c\<up>l \<and> l\<le>y"

theorem realfun_mon_conv_bound:
  assumes mon: "\<And>n. c n \<le> c (Suc n)"
  and bound: "\<And>n. c n \<le> (x::'a \<Rightarrow> real)"
  shows "\<exists>l. c\<up>l \<and> l\<le>x"
translations: theorem realfun_mon_conv_iff: "(u\<up>f) = (\<forall>w. (\<lambda>n. u n w)\<up>((f w)::real))"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. u\<up>f = (\<forall>w. (\<lambda>n. u n w)\<up>f w)
by (auto simp add: mon_conv_real_def mon_conv_real_fun_def le_fun_def)

text \<open>The long arrow signifies convergence of real sequences as
  defined in the theory \<open>SEQ\<close> \cite{Fleuriot:2000:MNR}. Monotone convergence
  for real functions is simply pointwise monotone convergence.

  Quite a few properties of these definitions will be necessary later,
  and they are listed now, giving only few select proofs.\<close>

(*This theorem, too, could be proved just the same for any ord
  Type!*)

lemma assumes mon_conv: "x\<up>(y::real)"
  shows mon_conv_mon: "(x i) \<le> (x (m+i))"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x i \<le> x (m + i)

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x i \<le> x (m + i)
proof (induct m)

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. x i \<le> x (0 + i)
 2. \<And>m. x i \<le> x (m + i) \<Longrightarrow> x i \<le> x (Suc m + i)
case 0

proof (state)
this:
  

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. x i \<le> x (0 + i)
 2. \<And>m. x i \<le> x (m + i) \<Longrightarrow> x i \<le> x (Suc m + i)
show ?case

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x i \<le> x (0 + i)
by simp

proof (state)
this:
  x i \<le> x (0 + i)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>m. x i \<le> x (m + i) \<Longrightarrow> x i \<le> x (Suc m + i)
next

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>m. x i \<le> x (m + i) \<Longrightarrow> x i \<le> x (Suc m + i)
case (Suc n)

proof (state)
this:
  x i \<le> x (n + i)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>m. x i \<le> x (m + i) \<Longrightarrow> x i \<le> x (Suc m + i)
also

proof (state)
this:
  x i \<le> x (n + i)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>m. x i \<le> x (m + i) \<Longrightarrow> x i \<le> x (Suc m + i)
from mon_conv

proof (chain)
picking this:
  x\<up>y
have "x (n+i) \<le> x (Suc n+i)"

proof (prove)
using this:
  x\<up>y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x (n + i) \<le> x (Suc n + i)
by (simp add: mon_conv_real_def)

proof (state)
this:
  x (n + i) \<le> x (Suc n + i)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>m. x i \<le> x (m + i) \<Longrightarrow> x i \<le> x (Suc m + i)
finally

proof (chain)
picking this:
  x i \<le> x (Suc n + i)
show ?case

proof (prove)
using this:
  x i \<le> x (Suc n + i)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x i \<le> x (Suc n + i)

proof (state)
this:
  x i \<le> x (Suc n + i)

goal:
No subgoals!
qed
lemma limseq_shift_iff: "(\<lambda>m. x (m+i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y = x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>m. x (m + i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
    x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>m. x (m + i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
    x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y
proof (induct i)

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. (\<lambda>m. x (m + 0)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
    x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y
 2. \<And>i.
       (\<lambda>m. x (m + i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
       x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y \<Longrightarrow>
       (\<lambda>m. x (m + Suc i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
       x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y
case 0

proof (state)
this:
  

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. (\<lambda>m. x (m + 0)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
    x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y
 2. \<And>i.
       (\<lambda>m. x (m + i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
       x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y \<Longrightarrow>
       (\<lambda>m. x (m + Suc i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
       x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y
show ?case

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>m. x (m + 0)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
    x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y
by simp

proof (state)
this:
  (\<lambda>m. x (m + 0)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
  x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>i.
       (\<lambda>m. x (m + i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
       x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y \<Longrightarrow>
       (\<lambda>m. x (m + Suc i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
       x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y
next

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>i.
       (\<lambda>m. x (m + i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
       x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y \<Longrightarrow>
       (\<lambda>m. x (m + Suc i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
       x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y
case (Suc n)

proof (state)
this:
  (\<lambda>m. x (m + n)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
  x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>i.
       (\<lambda>m. x (m + i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
       x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y \<Longrightarrow>
       (\<lambda>m. x (m + Suc i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
       x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y
also

proof (state)
this:
  (\<lambda>m. x (m + n)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
  x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>i.
       (\<lambda>m. x (m + i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
       x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y \<Longrightarrow>
       (\<lambda>m. x (m + Suc i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
       x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y
have "(\<lambda>m. x (m + n)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y = (\<lambda>m. x (Suc m + n)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>m. x (m + n)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
    (\<lambda>m. x (Suc m + n)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y
by (rule filterlim_sequentially_Suc[THEN sym])

proof (state)
this:
  (\<lambda>m. x (m + n)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
  (\<lambda>m. x (Suc m + n)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>i.
       (\<lambda>m. x (m + i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
       x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y \<Longrightarrow>
       (\<lambda>m. x (m + Suc i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
       x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y
also

proof (state)
this:
  (\<lambda>m. x (m + n)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
  (\<lambda>m. x (Suc m + n)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>i.
       (\<lambda>m. x (m + i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =

       (\<lambda>m. x (m + Suc i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
       x \<longlonglongrightarrow> y
have "\<dots> = (\<lambda>m. x (m + Suc n)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>m. x (Suc m + n)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
    (\<lambda>m. x (m + Suc n)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y
by simp

proof (state)
this:
  (\<lambda>m. x (Suc m + n)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =
  (\<lambda>m. x (m + Suc n)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>i.
       (\<lambda>m. x (m + i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y =

finally

proof (chain)
picking this:

proof (prove)
using this:

goal (1 subgoal):

theorem assumes mon_conv: "x\<up>(y::real)"
  shows real_mon_conv_le: "x i \<le> y"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x i \<le> y
proof -

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x i \<le> y
from mon_conv

proof (chain)
picking this:
  x\<up>y
have "(\<lambda>m. x (m+i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y"

proof (prove)
using this:
  x\<up>y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>m. x (m + i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y
by (simp add: mon_conv_real_def limseq_shift_iff)

proof (state)
this:
  (\<lambda>m. x (m + i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x i \<le> y
also

proof (state)
this:
  (\<lambda>m. x (m + i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x i \<le> y
from mon_conv

proof (chain)
picking this:
  x\<up>y
have "\<forall>m\<ge>0. x i \<le> x (m+i)"

proof (prove)
using this:
  x\<up>y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>m\<ge>0. x i \<le> x (m + i)
by (simp add: mon_conv_mon)

proof (state)
this:
  \<forall>m\<ge>0. x i \<le> x (m + i)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x i \<le> y
ultimately

proof (chain)
picking this:
  (\<lambda>m. x (m + i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y
  \<forall>m\<ge>0. x i \<le> x (m + i)
show ?thesis

proof (prove)
using this:
  (\<lambda>m. x (m + i)) \<longlonglongrightarrow> y
  \<forall>m\<ge>0. x i \<le> x (m + i)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x i \<le> y
by (rule LIMSEQ_le_const[OF _ exI[where x=0]])

proof (state)
this:
  x i \<le> y

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

theorem assumes mon_conv: "x\<up>(y::('a \<Rightarrow> real))"
  shows realfun_mon_conv_le: "x i \<le> y"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x i \<le> y
proof -

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x i \<le> y

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x i \<le> y
fix w

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x i \<le> y
from mon_conv

proof (chain)
picking this:
  x\<up>y
have "(\<lambda>i. x i w)\<up>(y w)"

proof (prove)
using this:
  x\<up>y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>i. x i w)\<up>y w
by (simp add: realfun_mon_conv_iff)

proof (state)
this:
  (\<lambda>i. x i w)\<up>y w

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x i \<le> y
hence "x i w \<le> y w"

proof (prove)
using this:
  (\<lambda>i. x i w)\<up>y w

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x i w \<le> y w
by (rule real_mon_conv_le)

proof (state)
this:
  x i w \<le> y w

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x i \<le> y

proof (state)
this:
  x i ?w2 \<le> y ?w2

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x i \<le> y
thus ?thesis

proof (prove)
using this:
  x i ?w2 \<le> y ?w2

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x i \<le> y
by (simp add: le_fun_def)

proof (state)
this:
  x i \<le> y

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

lemma assumes mon_conv: "x\<up>(y::real)"
  and less: "z < y"
  shows real_mon_conv_outgrow: "\<exists>n. \<forall>m. n \<le> m \<longrightarrow> z < x m"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. z < x m
proof -

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. z < x m
from less

proof (chain)
picking this:
  z < y
have less': "0 < y-z"

proof (prove)
using this:
  z < y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. 0 < y - z
by simp

proof (state)
this:
  0 < y - z

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. z < x m
have "\<exists>n.\<forall>m. n \<le> m \<longrightarrow> \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < y - z"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < y - z
proof -

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < y - z
from mon_conv

proof (chain)
picking this:
  x\<up>y
have aux: "\<And>r. r > 0 \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>n. \<forall>m. n \<le> m \<longrightarrow> \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < r"

proof (prove)
using this:
  x\<up>y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>r.
       0 < r \<Longrightarrow>
       \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < r
unfolding mon_conv_real_def lim_sequentially dist_real_def

proof (prove)
using this:
  (\<forall>n. x n \<le> x (Suc n)) \<and>
  (\<forall>r>0. \<exists>no. \<forall>n\<ge>no. \<bar>x n - y\<bar> < r)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>r.
       0 < r \<Longrightarrow>
       \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < r
by auto

proof (state)
this:
  0 < ?r \<Longrightarrow>
  \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < ?r

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < y - z
with less'

proof (chain)
picking this:
  0 < y - z
  0 < ?r \<Longrightarrow>
  \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < ?r
show "\<exists>n. \<forall>m. n \<le> m \<longrightarrow> \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < y - z"

proof (prove)
using this:
  0 < y - z
  0 < ?r \<Longrightarrow>
  \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < ?r

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < y - z
by auto

proof (state)
this:
  \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < y - z

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

proof (state)
this:
  \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < y - z

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. z < x m
also

proof (state)
this:
  \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < y - z

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. z < x m

proof (state)
this:
  \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < y - z

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. z < x m
fix m

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. z < x m
from mon_conv

proof (chain)
picking this:
  x\<up>y
have "x m \<le> y"

proof (prove)
using this:
  x\<up>y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. x m \<le> y
by (rule real_mon_conv_le)

proof (state)
this:
  x m \<le> y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. z < x m
hence "\<bar>x m - y\<bar> = y - x m"

proof (prove)
using this:
  x m \<le> y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<bar>x m - y\<bar> = y - x m
by arith

proof (state)
this:
  \<bar>x m - y\<bar> = y - x m

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. z < x m
also

proof (state)
this:
  \<bar>x m - y\<bar> = y - x m

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. z < x m
assume "\<bar>x m - y\<bar> < y - z"

proof (state)
this:
  \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < y - z

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. z < x m
ultimately

proof (chain)
picking this:
  \<bar>x m - y\<bar> = y - x m
  \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < y - z
have "z < x m"

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<bar>x m - y\<bar> = y - x m
  \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < y - z

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. z < x m
by arith

proof (state)
this:
  z < x m

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. z < x m

proof (state)
this:
  \<bar>x ?m2 - y\<bar> < y - z \<Longrightarrow> z < x ?m2

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. z < x m
ultimately

proof (chain)
picking this:
  \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < y - z
  \<bar>x ?m2 - y\<bar> < y - z \<Longrightarrow> z < x ?m2
show ?thesis

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. \<bar>x m - y\<bar> < y - z
  \<bar>x ?m2 - y\<bar> < y - z \<Longrightarrow> z < x ?m2

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. z < x m
by blast

proof (state)
this:
  \<exists>n. \<forall>m\<ge>n. z < x m

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

theorem real_mon_conv_times: 
  assumes xy: "x\<up>(y::real)" and nn: "0\<le>z"
  shows "(\<lambda>m. z*x m)\<up>(z*y)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>m. z * x m)\<up>z * y

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>m. z * x m)\<up>z * y
proof -

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>m. z * x m)\<up>z * y
from assms

proof (chain)
picking this:
  x\<up>y
  0 \<le> z
have "\<And>n. z*x n \<le> z*x (Suc n)"

proof (prove)
using this:
  x\<up>y
  0 \<le> z

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>n. z * x n \<le> z * x (Suc n)
by (simp add: mon_conv_real_def mult_left_mono)

proof (state)
this:
  z * x ?n \<le> z * x (Suc ?n)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>m. z * x m)\<up>z * y
also

proof (state)
this:
  z * x ?n \<le> z * x (Suc ?n)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>m. z * x m)\<up>z * y
from xy

proof (chain)
picking this:
  x\<up>y
have "(\<lambda>m. z*x m)\<longlonglongrightarrow>(z*y)"

proof (prove)
using this:
  x\<up>y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>m. z * x m) \<longlonglongrightarrow> z * y
by (simp add: mon_conv_real_def tendsto_const tendsto_mult)

proof (state)
this:
  (\<lambda>m. z * x m) \<longlonglongrightarrow> z * y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>m. z * x m)\<up>z * y
ultimately

proof (chain)
picking this:
  z * x ?n \<le> z * x (Suc ?n)
  (\<lambda>m. z * x m) \<longlonglongrightarrow> z * y
show ?thesis

proof (prove)
using this:
  z * x ?n \<le> z * x (Suc ?n)
  (\<lambda>m. z * x m) \<longlonglongrightarrow> z * y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>m. z * x m)\<up>z * y
by (simp add: mon_conv_real_def)

proof (state)
this:
  (\<lambda>m. z * x m)\<up>z * y

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

theorem realfun_mon_conv_times: 
  assumes xy: "x\<up>(y::'a\<Rightarrow>real)" and nn: "0\<le>z"
  shows "(\<lambda>m w. z*x m w)\<up>(\<lambda>w. z*y w)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>m w. z * x m w)\<up>(\<lambda>w. z * y w)

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>m w. z * x m w)\<up>(\<lambda>w. z * y w)
proof -

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>m w. z * x m w)\<up>(\<lambda>w. z * y w)
from assms

proof (chain)
picking this:
  x\<up>y
  0 \<le> z
have "\<And>w. (\<lambda>m. z*x m w)\<up>(z*y w)"

proof (prove)
using this:
  x\<up>y
  0 \<le> z

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>w. (\<lambda>m. z * x m w)\<up>z * y w
by (simp add: realfun_mon_conv_iff real_mon_conv_times)

proof (state)
this:
  (\<lambda>m. z * x m ?w)\<up>z * y ?w

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>m w. z * x m w)\<up>(\<lambda>w. z * y w)
thus ?thesis

proof (prove)
using this:
  (\<lambda>m. z * x m ?w)\<up>z * y ?w

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<lambda>m w. z * x m w)\<up>(\<lambda>w. z * y w)
by (auto simp add: realfun_mon_conv_iff)

proof (state)
this:
  (\<lambda>m w. z * x m w)\<up>(\<lambda>w. z * y w)

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

theorem real_mon_conv_bound:
  assumes mon: "\<And>n. c n \<le> c (Suc n)"
  and bound: "\<And>n. c n \<le> (x::real)"
  shows "\<exists>l. c\<up>l \<and> l\<le>x"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>l. c\<up>l \<and> l \<le> x
proof -

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>l. c\<up>l \<and> l \<le> x
from incseq_convergent[of c x] mon bound

proof (chain)
picking this:
  \<lbrakk>incseq c; \<forall>i. c i \<le> x;
   \<And>L.
      \<lbrakk>c \<longlonglongrightarrow> L;
       \<forall>i. c i \<le> L\<rbrakk>
      \<Longrightarrow> ?thesis\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> ?thesis
  c ?n \<le> c (Suc ?n)
  c ?n \<le> x
obtain l where "c \<longlonglongrightarrow> l" "\<forall>i. c i \<le> l"

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<lbrakk>incseq c; \<forall>i. c i \<le> x;
   \<And>L.
      \<lbrakk>c \<longlonglongrightarrow> L;
       \<forall>i. c i \<le> L\<rbrakk>
      \<Longrightarrow> ?thesis\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> ?thesis
  c ?n \<le> c (Suc ?n)
  c ?n \<le> x

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<And>l.
        \<lbrakk>c \<longlonglongrightarrow> l;
         \<forall>i. c i \<le> l\<rbrakk>
        \<Longrightarrow> thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis
by (auto simp: incseq_Suc_iff)

proof (state)
this:
  c \<longlonglongrightarrow> l
  \<forall>i. c i \<le> l

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>l. c\<up>l \<and> l \<le> x
moreover \<comment> \<open>This is like $\isacommand{also}$ but lacks the transitivity step.\<close>

proof (state)
this:
  c \<longlonglongrightarrow> l
  \<forall>i. c i \<le> l

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>l. c\<up>l \<and> l \<le> x
with bound

proof (chain)
picking this:
  c ?n \<le> x
  c \<longlonglongrightarrow> l
  \<forall>i. c i \<le> l
have "l \<le> x"

proof (prove)
using this:
  c ?n \<le> x
  c \<longlonglongrightarrow> l
  \<forall>i. c i \<le> l

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. l \<le> x
by (intro LIMSEQ_le_const2) auto

proof (state)
this:
  l \<le> x

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>l. c\<up>l \<and> l \<le> x
ultimately

proof (chain)
picking this:
  c \<longlonglongrightarrow> l
  \<forall>i. c i \<le> l
  l \<le> x
show ?thesis

proof (prove)
using this:
  c \<longlonglongrightarrow> l
  \<forall>i. c i \<le> l
  l \<le> x

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>l. c\<up>l \<and> l \<le> x
by (auto simp: mon_conv_real_def mon)

proof (state)
this:
  \<exists>l. c\<up>l \<and> l \<le> x

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

text \<open>This brings the theory to an end. Notice how the definition of the limit of a
  real sequence is visible in the proof to \<open>real_mon_conv_outgrow\<close>, a lemma that will be used for a
  monotonicity proof of the integral of simple functions later on.\<close>

(*<*)
  (*Another set construction. Needed in ImportPredSet, but Set is shadowed beyond 
  reconstruction there.
  Before making disjoint, we first need an ascending series of sets*)

primrec mk_mon::"(nat \<Rightarrow> 'a set) \<Rightarrow> nat \<Rightarrow> 'a set"
where
  "mk_mon A 0 = A 0"
| "mk_mon A (Suc n) = A (Suc n) \<union> mk_mon A n"
lemma "mk_mon A \<up> (\<Union>i. A i)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. mk_mon A\<up>\<Union> (range A)
proof (unfold mon_conv_set_def)

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<forall>n. mk_mon A n \<subseteq> mk_mon A (Suc n)) \<and>
    \<Union> (range A) = \<Union> (range (mk_mon A))

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<forall>n. mk_mon A n \<subseteq> mk_mon A (Suc n)) \<and>
    \<Union> (range A) = \<Union> (range (mk_mon A))
fix n

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<forall>n. mk_mon A n \<subseteq> mk_mon A (Suc n)) \<and>
    \<Union> (range A) = \<Union> (range (mk_mon A))
have "mk_mon A n \<subseteq> mk_mon A (Suc n)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. mk_mon A n \<subseteq> mk_mon A (Suc n)
by auto

proof (state)
this:
  mk_mon A n \<subseteq> mk_mon A (Suc n)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<forall>n. mk_mon A n \<subseteq> mk_mon A (Suc n)) \<and>
    \<Union> (range A) = \<Union> (range (mk_mon A))

proof (state)
this:
  mk_mon A ?n2 \<subseteq> mk_mon A (Suc ?n2)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<forall>n. mk_mon A n \<subseteq> mk_mon A (Suc n)) \<and>
    \<Union> (range A) = \<Union> (range (mk_mon A))
also

proof (state)
this:
  mk_mon A ?n2 \<subseteq> mk_mon A (Suc ?n2)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<forall>n. mk_mon A n \<subseteq> mk_mon A (Suc n)) \<and>
    \<Union> (range A) = \<Union> (range (mk_mon A))
have "(\<Union>i. mk_mon A i) = (\<Union>i. A i)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<Union> (range (mk_mon A)) = \<Union> (range A)
proof

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. \<Union> (range (mk_mon A)) \<subseteq> \<Union> (range A)
 2. \<Union> (range A) \<subseteq> \<Union> (range (mk_mon A))

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. \<Union> (range (mk_mon A)) \<subseteq> \<Union> (range A)
 2. \<Union> (range A) \<subseteq> \<Union> (range (mk_mon A))
fix i x

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. \<Union> (range (mk_mon A)) \<subseteq> \<Union> (range A)
 2. \<Union> (range A) \<subseteq> \<Union> (range (mk_mon A))
assume "x \<in> mk_mon A i"

proof (state)
this:
  x \<in> mk_mon A i

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. \<Union> (range (mk_mon A)) \<subseteq> \<Union> (range A)
 2. \<Union> (range A) \<subseteq> \<Union> (range (mk_mon A))
hence "\<exists>j. x \<in> A j"

proof (prove)
using this:
  x \<in> mk_mon A i

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>j. x \<in> A j
by (induct i) auto

proof (state)
this:
  \<exists>j. x \<in> A j

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. \<Union> (range (mk_mon A)) \<subseteq> \<Union> (range A)
 2. \<Union> (range A) \<subseteq> \<Union> (range (mk_mon A))

using this:
  \<exists>j. x \<in> A j

goal (1 subgoal):

by simp

proof (state)
this:
  x \<in> \<Union> (range A)

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. \<Union> (range (mk_mon A)) \<subseteq> \<Union> (range A)
 2. \<Union> (range A) \<subseteq> \<Union> (range (mk_mon A))

this:
  ?x2 \<in> mk_mon A ?i2 \<Longrightarrow> ?x2 \<in> \<Union> (range A)

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. \<Union> (range (mk_mon A)) \<subseteq> \<Union> (range A)
 2. \<Union> (range A) \<subseteq> \<Union> (range (mk_mon A))
thus "(\<Union>i. mk_mon A i) \<subseteq> (\<Union>i. A i)"

proof (state)
this:
  \<Union> (range (mk_mon A)) \<subseteq> \<Union> (range A)

proof (state)

No subgoals!

    \<Union> (range A) = \<Union> (range (mk_mon A))
ultimately

proof (chain)
picking this:
  mk_mon A ?n2 \<subseteq> mk_mon A (Suc ?n2)
  \<Union> (range (mk_mon A)) = \<Union> (range A)
show "(\<forall>n. mk_mon A n \<subseteq> mk_mon A (Suc n)) \<and> \<Union>(A ` UNIV) = (\<Union>n. mk_mon A n)"

proof (prove)
using this:
  mk_mon A ?n2 \<subseteq> mk_mon A (Suc ?n2)
  \<Union> (range (mk_mon A)) = \<Union> (range A)

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<forall>n. mk_mon A n \<subseteq> mk_mon A (Suc n)) \<and>
    \<Union> (range A) = \<Union> (range (mk_mon A))
by simp

proof (state)
this:
